chargeHist.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer
Throw/Discharge Bodily Fluid at Public Safety Worker or Prosecutor

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Armando H. Medrano

records.addlTxt:
10:02 AM Attorney Drew Lehman in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Armando H. Medrano not in court. Attorney Jillian Jean Scheidegger in court for Armando H. Medrano. Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES: Victim rights compliance. Attorney Scheidegger advises the Court that the DE is currently in custody at RCJ and is requesting an adjournment for reasons set forth on the record. The State does not object. Attorney Scheidegger requests the DE appear by zoom for the next hearing; Court will grant the request and contact RCJ to set up zoom appearance.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Defendant, Armando H. Medrano, appeared.  Attorney Brendaliz Valdes appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found.  Case bound over.   Information filed, reading waived.  Not guilty plea entered.  Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.
from court re rotation
Preliminary hearing on July 12, 2022 at 09:15 am.

02:00 PM   Assistant District Attorney Daniel Bernard Deida appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Pat Cafferty for Atty Scheidegger.   Clerk JT  Minutes:  Defendant requests preliminary hearing:  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 12, 2022 at 09:15 am..   Cash bond posted and continued w/ same conditions (see previous bond entry). rb

Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 22, 2022 at 01:00 pm.  Bond continued.  DE working on getting an Attorney.  Not eligible for Adv. Counsel.  Time limints tolled.  sg

records.addlTxt: Petition for Appointment of Attorney paperwork put in criminal clerk bin
Status conference on May 2, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant, Armando H. Medrano, appeared.  Attorney Drew Lehman appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  DE is not eligible for SPD and is given advocate counsel paperwork today.   DE waives time for the preliminary hearing.  Bond continued.  Status conference scheduled for May 2, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
SPD-Not Eligible

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.
  *Not to Possess or Consume Alcohol.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  *Not to drive w/o VALID Driver's License.

01:51 PM  State appears by Attorney Alexandra Smathers.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Michelle Knapp.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 10 days; set before Commissioner on April 20, 2022 at 09:15 am.  $1000  Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry).  Deft is not eligible for SPD if released.  Deft given advocate counsel paperwork today.  kmk
